avalancheActivity.highlights: On very steep sunny slopes crampons are useful
avalancheActivity.comment:
On extremely steep sunny slopes small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible. In the evening as the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches. On shady slopes the danger of moist and wet avalanches is lower.
Individual gliding avalanches can also be released in the night or in the morning, in particular on extremely steep grassy slopes below approximately 2700 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.

The sometimes moderate wind has transported the old snow. The mostly small wind slabs of Tuesday can be released by a single winter sport participant at high altitude, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular in high Alpine regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise on Tuesday to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. As a consequence of high temperatures and solar radiation the snowpack settled during the last few days. Shady slopes: The upper section of the snowpack is dry and has a loosely bonded surface.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface during the last two days, in particular below approximately 2700 m on very steep sunny slopes.
The various wind slabs have bonded generally well with the old snowpack.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: As the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations will stabilise.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.
avalancheActivity.comment:
On extremely steep sunny slopes small dry and moist snow slides are to be expected, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain. In the evening as the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations stabilised. They can be released in isolated cases and generally at high altitude, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on extremely steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2700 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: As the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

avalancheActivity.highlights: On very steep sunny slopes crampons are useful
avalancheActivity.comment:
On extremely steep sunny slopes only isolated small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry and moist snow slides are possible, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain. In the evening as the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches.
The older wind slabs are to be found above approximately 2400 m. They are rather rare but are barely recognisable. Avalanches can be released by people. Caution is to be exercised in particular on extremely steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example.
Additionally in isolated cases avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach medium size.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise on Tuesday to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good.
Hardly any more slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days. The various wind slabs have bonded generally well with the old snowpack.
Shady slopes: The upper section of the snowpack is dry and has a loosely bonded surface. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface during the last two days, in particular below approximately 2700 m on very steep sunny slopes.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2700 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: As the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches.
